parts.instructions: Complete the summary below on the lecture on the Wechsler-Belleview Intelligence Scale. Write NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS from the listening for each answer.

questions.prompt: Wechsler believed intelligence was made up of different skills considered within the context of the ________.
His intelligence scale broke away from existing intelligence tests and set up a numerical scale with the ________ set at 100.

Wechsler decided to create a test to measure these different skills that made up intelligence. The 2 main areas tested were ________ and performance and these were then broken down to 14 sub-tests, 7 for each.
These 14 topics remain the basis for today’s WBIS, which is today’s most commonly used ________.
The WBIS is aimed at adults; for younger children other related scales are used, neither of which need ________ in a child.
The WBIS is not suitable for assessing ________ of intelligence or of the age range.
For any of these situations, care should be taken with ________ of the results.
The WBIS can also be used for neuropsychological assessment. Differences in answers can indicate types of ________.
Although experts say the WBIS is best used only for intelligence, it is used to compare cognitive development and performance in social skills or at ________.
The WBIS is highly regarded as an intelligence test and is often used as a point of comparison for other tests when assessing their ________ and validity.
